title: Firefox: About memory consumption
content:
Hi, all technology gurus.

I'm using Firefox ver.88.0.1 and recently noticed that Firefox uses much memory for almost all webpages (e.g. Youtube, reddit, Gmail, Wiki...)

Very often the memory consumption reaches 4.5GB and sometimes Firefox starts to work awkwardly (responds to mouse very slowly, e.g. responds after 1min. ) Garbage Collection reduces a bit to 4.485GB and Firefox still works awkwardly. Only Restarting Firefox resolves this issue (memory consumption reduces to 1.884GB, that is 2.7GB reduction!). (See attached pictures)

Should I think this is proper and intended behavior of Firefox? I cannot help thinking that some kind of needless memory allocations are happening during Firefox keep running. Anyone has suggestion or thought about this ?

Sincerely
creator: ghc03361

title: Firefox not taking input from userChrome.css
content: My tab bar is way, way too small on Linux. I followed Arch's own documentation on how to fix this by increasing `layout.css.devPixelsPerPx` (mine is at 1.4), and then adjusting font size by editing userChrome.css to select the desired size. Problem is that Firefox won't actually change anything based on what I put in that file. I have set `toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets` to True, and I have attached a photo of my userChrome.css (yes, I'm using nano because Vim is too advanced for my smooth brain). I changed it to a ton of different values and I can confirm that the font size is not actually changing.
creator: csparrow101

title: Default search engine is locked.
content: Latest version installed a few days ago. Google was set as my default search engine. I can not remove google, and in the Search section of preferences I find only google. I can not add search engines or set a new default browser. A fix will be much appreciated.
creator: sevenspires

title: Password not recognized
content: This is my first time here. Never had any issues that I couldn't resolve until now. Here's my dilemma. I have 3 machines, 2 Levono / 1 Dell and they all run Firefox. I recently changed my primary password because I received warnings that my email was found on the dark web (Dark web? I'm behind the times. I digress.) One of my Lenovo machines will not accept the new password. I have changed it several times but still it will not recognize the new primary password. It won't sync with the other machines. Here's the kicker, it tells me I'm logged in!!! Can't do anything on the account. My other 2 machines are fine. Changed the password with no issues. That brings me to another question. Shouldn't the password sync across all 3 machines? Everything else syncs. I literally had 3 different passwords at one time (because I kept forgetting them. I write them down now). Hope somebody can shed the light for me. So frustrated. May have to go to Chrome if this keeps up.
creator: joeydrisk

title: Loss of tags by FireFox update (probably 4 - 5 years ago)
content: During a periodic update to Firefox all my tags were removed. I had been misusing the field to store contact name, email addresses, phone numbers, and snail mail of my contacts with staff of the site which I worked with.
creator: chiefjoe

title: Unable to get Firefox to stick as my preferred browser on my new 24-inch iMac
content: I always use Firefox as my preferred browser on my Macs but am unable to get it to stick on my new 24-inch iMac that I just received a couple of days ago. Does anyone know if there is a bug when using this brand new iMac? I keep going in and setting it in preferences and checking "Restore previous session" and it works for a while and then goes back to Safari and I lose all my tabs. I was doing some banking so exited out of Firefox several times and sometimes my previous session was restored but then, after a few times, it went back to Safari. Then I went back into Firefox and my previous session was gone again. Thanks for any help that you can offer.
creator: Fi424
